evidence.text:
Person B: [Nai Nai, don’t feed him. He can grab it himself.]
Person B: [Only one more month until my little bird flies away, hmm?]

Person A: [Vivian. Don’t be loud.]
Person A: [DON’T SAY DIRTY WORDS!]
Person B: [Didi! You didn’t finish eating!] *

Person A: [Vivian! Dishes!]
Person A: [Don’t put the camera on the ground!] It’s a bad angle. [Your composition will be ugly.]

Person B: [Why were you guys fighting?]
Person A: [PLAYING!? THIS IS PLAYING!? [See? You let them go out and this happens. Children are supposed to be playing with crickets by the creek and your son’s fighting like a gangster! If the police sees, they’re going to think you beat him and take him away! He’s gonna go blind and then he won’t be able to get into college or get a good job which means he won’t be able to find a beautiful wife to have children with and the Wang family legacy is over!] *
Person A: [Ai-ya. My son would never let this happen if he were here.]
Person B: [Well, he’s not here.]
Person A: [Didi. Does it hurt?]
Person A: [Let me do the dishes. You don’t wash them clean enough anyways.]

Person B: [See? This is why the house is so chaotic! Because you never let me help.]
Person B: [No wonder my son doesn’t want to be home.]
Person B: [ME? BURDEN? All I offer to do is help because clearly you can’t handle it. And if my son weren’t out there working, making money, this family would have nothing and we would all be homeless.]

Person B: [Nai Nai is so old. How many years do I have left?...I won’t even be here to see you finish high school.]
Person A: [Nai Nai. Lie down.] [Kids, it’s fine. You can leave. Let Nai Nai rest.]
